The departure of UnitedHealthCare: the nation's largest insurer, from Arizona's marketplace, which could result in 30,000 Arizonans having no choice for healthcare coverage.
The submission of 2017 Affordable Care A: revealing that in eight rural Arizona counties, only one health insurer, Blue Cross Blue Shield, signed up to cover individuals.
The U: S. Department of Health and Human Services data indicating that 30,761 people across all eight counties bought coverage through the exchange as of Feb. 1, 2016, but not specifying how many people have either United or Blue Cross.
The statement from Allen Gjersvig: director of Enrollment Services at Arizona Alliance for Community Health Centers, that there will be counties and consumers who will only have one insurance company option, with Blue Cross having filed rates for all counties in Arizona.
